wikitext.*:
{{disambig-two|the forest in [[Doriath]]|forest in [[Rhûn]]|[[Neldoreth (Rhûn)|Neldoreth]]}} {{location infobox | name=Neldoreth | image=Ted Nasmith - By Moonlight in Neldoreth Forest.jpg | caption="By Moonlight in Neldoreth Forest" by [[Ted Nasmith]] | pronun= | othernames=''Taur-na-neldor'' ([[Sindarin|S]]) | location=Doriath | type=Forest | description= | regions= | towns= | inhabitants=[[Iathrim]] | created= | destroyed= | events=Meeting of Beren and Lúthien | gallery=Neldoreth }} {{quote|To the beeches of Neldoreth I came in the Autumn.
Ah! the gold and the red and the sighing of leaves in the Autumn in Taur-na-neldor!|[[In the Willow-meads of Tasarinan|Treebeard's song]]}} The '''Forest of Neldoreth''' was the [[Beeches|beech]]-forest that lay between the banks of the [[Esgalduin|Esgalduin River]] and the [[Mindeb|Mindeb River]] that formed the northern and lesser part of the Kingdom of [[Doriath]].{{S|Map}} ==History== It was in the Forest of Neldoreth that [[Lúthien]] was born and later these woods were part of the enclosure called the "[[Girdle of Melian]]".{{S|Sindar}} It was also under the trees of Neldoreth that [[Beren]] first beheld Lúthien dancing in the moonlight. Later, when [[Sauron]] had cast Beren into a pit and Lúthien resolved to rescue him, [[Thingol]] had her imprisoned in a house built high in the branches of the highest tree of the forest, called [[Hírilorn]].{{S|Beren}} When [[Treebeard]] was carrying [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] to [[Wellinghall]] he chanted to them about walking in the woods of the [[First Age]]. He recalled coming to Neldoreth in Autumn and enjoying the gold and red and sighing leaves of ''Taur-na-neldor'' (an alternate name for the forest).{{TT|III4}}, "[[In the Willow-meads of Tasarinan]]" ==Etymology== The name ''Neldoreth'' is unclear, but seems to be a compound of ''[[neldor]]'' ("beech") and the abstract noun ending ''-eth''.{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1206589265.html|articlename=S. ''Neldoreth'' loc.|dated=|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 November 2019}} ''Taur-na-neldor'' more clearly means "Beech-forest": ''[[taur]]'' ("forest"), ''[[na]]'' ("of") and ''neldor''.{{HM|RC}}, p. 384 ==Other versions of the legendarium== On an early draft map for ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', Tolkien indicated that ''[[Neldoreth (Rhûn)|Neldoreth]]'' was the name of the forest bordering the north-eastern shore of the [[Sea of Rhûn]]. This forest went unnamed in later maps.{{TI|MII}}, p. 307 [[Treebeard]]'s home was also called the '''Forest of Neldoreth''' in an early draft.{{RS|New}}, p. 384 {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Neldoreth}} [[Category:Doriath]] [[Category:Forests]] [[de:Neldoreth]] [[fr:encyclo/geographie/forets/beleriand/neldoreth]] [[fi:Neldorethin metsä]]
